page.title: Talk:National Guard Militia Museum of New Jersey

revision.text:
{{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history |class=B <!-- B-Class 5-criteria checklist --> <!-- B-Class-1. It is suitably referenced, and all major points have appropriate inline citations. --> |B1=y <!-- B-Class-2. It reasonably covers the topic, and does not contain obvious omissions or inaccuracies. --> |B2=y <!-- B-Class-3. It has a defined structure, including a lead section and one or more sections of content. --> |B3=y <!-- B-Class-4. It is free from major grammatical errors. --> |B4=y <!-- B-Class-5. It contains appropriate supporting materials, such as an infobox, images, or diagrams. -->|B5=y |US=y }} {{WikiProject New Jersey|class=B|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Museums|class=B|importance=low}} }} {{DYK talk|18 November|2008|entry=... that the '''[[National Guard Militia Museum of New Jersey]]''' has on display the [[Intelligent Whale]], an experimental [[American Civil War|Civil War]]-era [[submarine]] propelled by a hand crank operated by its four-man crew?|views=1011}}
== DYK == {{*mp}}... that the '''[[National Guard Militia Museum of New Jersey]]''' has on display the [[Intelligent Whale]], an experimental [[American Civil War|Civil War]]-era [[submarine]] propelled by a hand crank operated by its four-man crew?
== Intelligent Whale ==
''The [[Intelligent Whale]], an experimental hand-cranked submarine based on an 1863 design is on display.''
This is what the article text says, but the photo caption says the submarine is in the Washington Navy Yard. Which place is correct?--[[User:Dthomsen8|DThomsen8]] ([[User talk:Dthomsen8|talk]]) 12:20, 26 April 2010 (UTC)
:I assume the photo is old, and the museum accepted the boat when the Navy wanted the space. However, the picture is undated and the history unspecified. [[User:Jim.henderson|Jim.henderson]] ([[User talk:Jim.henderson|talk]]) 12:26, 26 April 2010 (UTC)
